title.narrative: EQUITY & CHILD FOCUSED SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: National authorities have increased capacity and evidence to enhance the equity and child focus of the national social protection system., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Evaluation, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Research, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, child-related national policies, budgets and systems, including the child protection system, are inclusive and equity- focused.

participating-org.narrative: GENERAL DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND WEL SERVICE
MINISTRY OF LABOR AND SOCIAL PROTEC

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Expanding and improving cash transfers for children
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Policy and strategy development and coordination
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Strengthening integrated administrative systems (such as beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, payments)
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National authorities have increased capacity and evidence to enhance the equity and child focus of the national social protectionsystem.

description.narrative: UNICEF Mongolia’s technical support in generation of solid evidence and high level policy advocacy has resulted in continued vertical expansion of Government’s flagship social protection programme for children throughout 2021 helping the families in overcoming the COVID-19 pandemic challenges related to income and livelihood loss. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2021

title.narrative: Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty, Text

target.value: 2022:Yes: Government's targeted programmes on social and human development are reflective of child poverty analysis

actual.value: 2021:MDP analysis is completed and findings presented. Influencing the Governments policies.

title.narrative: Evidence of use of budget and impact analyses for improved programme design/targeting(48912), Text

target.value: 2021:Policy advocacy for increased budget for child-sensitive social protection and efficient use of budgets for child protection based on the findings of the social sector budget review and programme based budgeting in child protection.

title.narrative: Shock-responsive SP: Shock-responsive SP: Policy/strategy is adapted to support appropriate and timely vertical and/or horizontal expansion expansion of the existing social protection systems during crisis by government and/or humanitarian agencies (Link, Text

target.value: 2022:SRSP measure for children was designed, tested and informed Government's action during COVID-19 creating a wealth of evidence

actual.value: 2021:A wealth of evidence and lessons were generated.
